8(a) Initial Application

  • Overview
  • Documents
  • Messages

Appeal the SBA’s decision

The Office of Hearings and Appeals (OHA) will decide your appeal. You can’t apply for reconsideration if you lose the appeal. To appeal, SBA must receive the following information within 45 days of the date of your decline letter.

  1. The basis of OHA’s jurisdiction in handling your appeal. Look in your decline letter in your Messages tab for the reason your firm was denied entry into the 8(a) program. If your firm was denied entry based on any reason other than social disadvantage, economic disadvantage, ownership, or control, then OHA can’t process your appeal.
  2. A copy of your decline letter and the date you received it
  3. A brief description of your case and the legal arguments that your firm meets the requirements of the 8(a) program
  4. The outcome you wish to see from your appeal
  5. Your name, address, phone, fax (if you have one), email, and signature (or your lawyer’s name, contact information, and signature if your lawyer is handling the appeal)
  6. A statement of why you believe the SBA’s decision is arbitrary, unreasonable, or contrary to law. Refer to specific parts of your decline letter and related documents or emails.
  7. Your submission to OHA must include a certificate of service stating how, when, and to whom your appeal was sent. For each party, including the SBA’s Director of Business Development and the Associate General Counsel for Procurement Law, please include:

    “I certify that on [date], I served the foregoing [type of submission] by [email, mail, Express Mail, personal delivery, commercial delivery service, fax] upon the following.” Next list the name and address of each party served and the fax number or email. You must sign the certificate and print or type your name and title.

Important information

Once you appeal, SBA will not accept a request for reconsideration. OHA’s decision on your appeal will be the final decision.

For instructions, including how to format and the length of your appeal, read 13 CFR § 124.206, 13 CFR § 134.203, 13 CFR § 134.402, and 13 CFR § 134.204(d).

Email your appeal to all 3 of these offices

  1. Office of Hearings and Appeals: OHAFilings@sba.gov
  2. Director, Office of Business Development: 8aBD2@sba.gov
  3. Associate General Counsel for Procurement Law: OPLService@sba.gov
